decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out except in complete accordance with the details shown on plan references: PROP-GF-10-REV-A; PROP-ROOF-11-REV-A; PROP-ELEV-12; PROP-ELEV-13-REV-A and shall thereafter be retained/maintained for as long as the development remains in existence.
To ensure the development complies with the provisions Hillingdon Local Plan Parts 1 (November 2012) and 2 (January 2020) and the London Plan (2021).

The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those stated on approved plans, numbers: PROP-GF-10-REV-A; PROP-ROOF-11-REV-A; PROP-ELEV-13-REV-A and shall thereafter be retained as such.

To safeguard the visual amenities of the area and to ensure that the proposed development does not have an adverse effect upon the appearance of the existing building in accordance with Policy DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020).

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (as amended) (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no windows, doors, or other openings shall be constructed in the walls of the north elevation, along the boundary with the neighbouring 257 Church Road.
To prevent inappropriate overlooking to 257 Church Road in accordance with Policy DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020).

Access to the flat roof over the extension hereby approved shall be for maintenance or emergency purposes only and the flat roof shall not be used as a roof garden, terrace, balcony, patio, or similar amenity area.
To prevent overlooking to adjoining properties in accordance with policy policy DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020).
description: Erection of a single-storey rear extension following demolition of outbuilding
